ca.ualberta.cmput301w14t08.geochan.fragments
Class CustomLocationFragment

java.lang.Object
  android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      ca.ualberta.cmput301w14t08.geochan.fragments.CustomLocationFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener
public class CustomLocationFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment

This class is a fragment which allows the user to specify a custom location for their post. It gives the user the ability to select a location on a map, pick from previously used locations, or simply use the user's current location.

Author:
Brad Simons

onStart

public void onStart()
Setups up the Location Log to display previous locations, connects the UI buttons, starts listening for location updates and finally calls setup map. Gets the proper fragment manager and sets it to fragManager.

Overrides:
onStart in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

onStop

public void onStop()
Calls onStop in the super class and tells the locationListenerService to stop listening for location updates

Overrides:
onStop in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

submitCurrentLocation

public void submitCurrentLocation(android.view.View view)
Called when a user clicks the current location button. Gets the user's current location, puts it in a bundle and passes it back to the previous fragment

Parameters:
view - A View for the Button that was pressed.

submitNewLocation

public void submitNewLocation(android.view.View view)
Called when a user clicks the submit button. If the user has placed a location marker on the map, that location is placed in a bundle and passed back to the previous fragment

Parameters:
view - A View for the Button that was pressed.

setBundleArguments

public void setBundleArguments(GeoLocation locationToSubmit,
                               java.lang.String locationType)
Bundles up all arguments required to be passed to previous fragment. This depends on the post type. It will attach latitude, longitude and description of the location to be submitted, as well as the type of location being returned (current location of user or a new location set on the map)

Parameters:
locationType - A string representing the location type that is being submitted.
